Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: The task focuses on identifying anomalies and undesirable behaviors in event log data for order processes. The goal is to analyze deviations from the normal process flow to detect issues.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The standard order process begins with registering the order in sales. Next, a credit check is performed by the finance department.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After the credit check, the warehouse validates stock availability. Logistics then confirms shipment and ships the goods, followed by finance issuing an invoice. Finally, finance handles receiving payment to complete the order process.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 1001 follows the normal flow without any deviations. Cases 1002, 1003, and 1004 show various anomalies needing further review.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Confirm Shipment and Ship Goods occur before Credit Check and Validate Stock, which is risky. This sequence could lead to shipping without ensuring creditworthiness or stock availability.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Ship Goods happens before Validate Stock and Confirm Shipment, creating logistical risks. Confirm Shipment occurs after Ship Goods, indicating a timing issue in the process.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Case 1004 starts with Register Order but cuts off at Receive, suggesting incomplete data. Further information is needed to assess potential anomalies.
